title: Right Hand Switch Housing - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
During installation make sure the damper rubber remains seated in the groove of the switch housing.
Position a new retaining clip into the handlebar in the orientation noted during removal and slide the switch housing onto the handlebar.
Slide over the retaining clip until it locks into position.
To aid orientation, there are coloured dots on each connector. The coloured dots identify the bottom face of the connector.

When inserting the connectors, carefully locate the connectors into their sockets, then use a suitable tool to push the connectors fully home. An audible click can be heard when the connectors are fully inserted.
Do not use sharp tools, such as a flat bladed screw driver to insert the connectors.
Using a new cable tie, secure the wiring harness with the rubber shroud only to the switch housing.

body.name: Right hand switch housing cable tie_L0523

body.body: Install operations CB7; CM7 CN7 CS7 CT7 CE7 CF7
Front Brake Master Cylinder Assembly - Partial Installation

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: CF7; CE7; CB7; CT7; CS7; CR7; CN7; CM7

body.body: Move the handlebars to left and right full lock while checking that the brake hose, clutch cable and electrical harnesses do not bind or that the steering feels tight or difficult to turn. A hose, cable or harness that binds, or steering that is tight/difficult to turn will restrict the steering and may cause loss of control and an accident.

Check for correct operation of the front brake, clutch and twist grip. Check that the brake hose, clutch cable and electrical harnesses do not bind or restrict the steering when the handlebars are turned from lock-to-lock. Rectify as necessary.

Perform the following operations:
Front Brake Master Cylinder Assembly - Partial Installation
Twist Grip - Installation
Handguards - Installation
Battery - Terminal Connect
Rider's Seat - Removal/Installation

Move the handlebars to left and right full lock while checking that the brake hose, clutch cable and electrical harnesses do not bind or that the steering feels tight or difficult to turn. A hose, cable or harness that binds, or steering that is tight/difficult to turn will restrict the steering and may cause loss of control and an accident.

Check for correct operation of the front brake, clutch and twist grip. Check that the brake hose, clutch cable and electrical harnesses do not bind or restrict the steering when the handlebars are turned from lock-to-lock. Rectify as necessary.
